criteria: Identification of Trusted Adults at Home
Identification of Trusted Adults at School
Understanding of the Role of Trusted Adults in Mental and Emotional Health
descriptions: The student cannot identify any trusted adults at home who can assist with mental and emotional health concerns.
The student can identify one adult at home, but the choice may be questionable in terms of reliability or appropriateness.
The student can identify one trusted adult at home who can potentially assist with mental and emotional health concerns, but lacks detail.
The student can identify one or two trusted adults at home and provides a reasonable explanation of why they are considered trustworthy.
The student can identify two or more trusted adults at home, providing clear and appropriate reasons for their selection, demonstrating good understanding of supportive relationships.

The student comprehensively identifies multiple trusted adults at home, clearly articulating their roles in providing mental and emotional support, and demonstrates a nuanced understanding of healthy family dynamics.
The student cannot identify any trusted adults at school who can assist with mental and emotional health concerns.
The student identifies one adult at school, but the choice is questionable regarding their role or suitability.
The student identifies one trusted adult at school who can potentially assist with mental and emotional health concerns, but lacks detail.
The student identifies one or two trusted adults at school and provides a reasonable explanation of why they are considered trustworthy.
The student identifies two or more trusted adults at school, providing clear and appropriate reasons for their selection, demonstrating good understanding of supportive school relationships.

The student comprehensively identifies multiple trusted adults at school, clearly articulating their roles in providing mental and emotional support, and demonstrates a nuanced understanding of supportive school environments.
The student demonstrates no understanding of why one might seek help from a trusted adult for mental or emotional health concerns.
The student shows limited understanding of the role trusted adults play, offering vague or incomplete reasons.
The student identifies that trusted adults can provide help but lacks specific examples or explanations.
The student explains that trusted adults can provide support, guidance, or a listening ear, but explanation may be basic.
The student clearly articulates the various ways trusted adults can support mental and emotional health, such as providing advice, emotional support, or connecting them with resources.

The student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the multifaceted role trusted adults play in mental and emotional health, including specific examples of how they can provide support, advocate for well-being, and foster healthy coping mechanisms.
